tit.e: Fukusa basami (pouch for a silk wrapping cloth and other small items used for the tea ceremony)
Fukusa basami (pouch for a silk wrapping cloth and other small items used for the tea ceremony)
Fukusa basami (pouch for a silk wrapping cloth and other small items used for the tea ceremony)

sen.j: 袱紗挟み（ふくさばさみ）または懐紙入れ（かいしいれ）とは、茶道の稽古や茶席において必要となる小物を一まとめに入れて携帯する袋の総称である。
sen.e: The term "fukusa basami," also referred to as "kaishi ire" (literally, "Japanese pocket tissue pouch"), is a generic name given to pouches used to put together and carry small items necessary for tea ceremony lessons or tea ceremony parties.

Fukusa basami, also referred to as Kaishi ire (literally, Japanese pocket tissue pouch), is a generic name given to pouches used to put together and carry small items necessary for tea ceremony lessons or tea ceremony parties.

Fukusa basami, also referred to as Kaishi ire (literally, Japanese pocket tissue pouch), is a generic name given to pouches used to put together and carry small items necessary for tea ceremony lessons or tea ceremony parties.

sen.j: 袱紗挟みは比較的小ぶりの物を指し、三つ折り・つづれ・二つ折り（利休型）などに分類されるが、いずれも用途は同じである。
sen.e: Fukusa basami pouches are comparatively small and each pouch is classified into a three-folded type, a handwoven brocade type, or a double-folded type (also called Rikyu type), but all these types are used for the same purpose.
sen.cmt: つづれというのは織の種類であるため他2つの分類（三つ折り、二つ折り）とは種類が異なるように思われますが、原文のまま訳出いたしました。
sen.e: Fukusa basami pouches are comparatively small and each pouch is classified into a three-folded type, a handwoven brocade type, or a double-folded type (also called Rikyu type), but all these types are used for the same purpose.

Fukusa basami pouches are comparatively small and each pouch is classified into a three-folded type, a handwoven brocade type, or a double-folded type (also called Rikyu type), but all these types are used for the same purpose.

sen.j: 男性用がやや大ぶりで寒色系、女性用がやや小ぶりで暖色系などの違いはあるが、形や使い方の違いはほとんどない。
sen.e: Although men's fukusa basami are somewhat bigger and use cold colors while women's fukusa basami are relatively smaller and use warm colors, their shapes and their purposes of use are almost the same.

Although men's fukusa basami are somewhat bigger and use cold colors while women's fukusa basami are relatively smaller and use warm colors, their shapes and their purposes of use are almost the same.

Although men's fukusa basami are somewhat bigger and use cold colors while women's fukusa basami are relatively smaller and use warm colors, their shapes and their purposes of use are almost the same.

sen.j: 袱紗
sen.e: Fukusa (silk wrapping cloth)
Fukusa (silk wrapping cloth)
Fukusa (silk wrapping cloth)

sen.j: 茶席において茶碗などの茶道具を清めたりする場合に用いる布。
sen.e: This is a cloth which is used to clean off tea bowls and other tea equipment at tea ceremony parties.
This is a cloth which is used to clean off tea bowls and other tea equipment at tea ceremony.
This is a cloth which is used to clean off tea bowls and other tea equipment at tea ceremony.

sen.j: 使い袱紗とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: This is also referred to as tsukai-fukusa (literally, "fukusa for use").
This is also referred to as tsukai-fukusa (literally, fukusa for use).
This is also referred to as tsukai-fukusa (literally, fukusa for use).

sen.j: 客側であれば袱紗が必要になることはあまりないが、流派によっては茶器の拝見の際などに使われる場合もある。
sen.e: Guests at a tea ceremony party rarely need to use their fukusa, but some schools require guests to use their fukusa when they view tea bowls.
Guests at a tea ceremony rarely need to use their fukusa, but some schools require guests to use their fukusa when they view tea bowls.
Guests at a tea ceremony rarely need to use their fukusa, but some schools require guests to use their fukusa when they view tea bowls.

sen.j: 一般の冠婚葬祭に使用する袱紗とは種類が異なる。
sen.e: Fukusa for the tea ceremony are different from fukusa used for funerals, weddings, and other ceremonial occasions.
Fukusa for the tea ceremony are different from fukusa used for funerals, weddings, and other ceremonial occasions.
Fukusa for the tea ceremony are different from fukusa used for funerals, weddings, and other ceremonial occasions.

sen.j: 男性用・女性用で色が違い、男性は紫、女性は朱色・赤を用いる。
sen.e: Men's fukusa and women's fukusa are different in terms of colors; basically, men's fukusa are purple and women's fukusa are cinnabar red or red.
Fukusa for men is different color from that for women; basically, purple for men and cinnabar red or red for women.
Fukusa for men is different color from that for women; basically, purple for men and cinnabar red or red for women.

sen.j: 柄物などは流派によって扱いが違い、厳しく制限されている場合と、まったく問題とならない場合とがある。
sen.e: Rules of cloth patterns vary depending on schools, and some schools strictly restrict the use of patterns while some schools have no restriction on the use of patterns.
Rules of cloth patterns vary depending on schools, and some schools strictly restrict the use of patterns while some schools have no restriction on the use of patterns.
Rules of cloth patterns vary depending on schools, and some schools strictly restrict the use of patterns while some schools have no restriction on the use of patterns.

sen.j: 大きさは男性用・女性用ともに同じ。
sen.e: Men's fukusa and women's fukusa are the same in size.
Fukusa for men's and women's are the same in size.
Fukusa for men's and women's are the same in size.

sen.j: 材質は正絹・木綿・化繊など様々である。
sen.e: There are various materials used to make fukusa, such as silk, cotton, or synthetic fibers.
There are various materials used to make fukusa, such as silk, cotton, or synthetic fibers.
There are various materials used to make fukusa, such as silk, cotton, or synthetic fibers.

tit.e: Kobukusa (cloth which is about one fourth of the size of a fukusa)
Kobukusa (cloth which is about one fourth of the size of a fukusa)
Kobukusa (cloth which is about one fourth of the size of a fukusa)

sen.j: 茶器の拝見や点て出しの際に用いる。
sen.e: This is used when tea ceremony attendants view tea bowls or when they carry out already whisked tea and present it to the various other guests.
sen.cmt: 「点て出し」については説明的に訳出いたしました。
sen.e: This is used when tea ceremony attendants view tea bowls or when they carry out already whisked tea and present it to the various other guests.
This is used when tea ceremony attendants view tea bowls or when they carry out already whisked tea and present it to the various other guests.

sen.j: 表千家では使われない。
sen.e: Omotesenke (the house of Omotesen) does not use this.
Omotesenke school does not use this.
Omotesenke school does not use this.

sen.j: 茶道用の扇子。
sen.e: This is a special sensu for the tea ceremony.
This is a special sensu for the tea ceremony.
This is a special sensu for the tea ceremony.

sen.j: 一般の扇子よりはやや小ぶりで、茶扇子とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: Tea ceremony sensu are slightly smaller than regular folding fans, and they are also called chazensu (literally, "tea sensu").
Tea ceremony sensu are slightly smaller than regular folding fans, and they are also called chazensu (literally, tea sensu).
Tea ceremony sensu are slightly smaller than regular folding fans, and they are also called chazensu (literally, tea sensu).

sen.j: 扇ぐためのものではなく、亭主と客の間、あるいは客同士の間の結界茶道における結界として挨拶のときに用いる。
sen.e: These sensu are not used as an actual fan, but they are used to represent a boundary between a host and a group of guests, or between guests when they exchange greetings with each other.
These sensu are not used as an actual fan, but they are used to represent a boundary between a host and a group of guests, or between guests when they exchange greetings with each other.
These sensu are not used as an actual fan, but they are used to represent a boundary between a host and a group of guests, or between guests when they exchange greetings with each other.

sen.j: 色は黒の塗り生地、竹の白生地など。
sen.e: Some sensu have black-painted sticks and other sensu have plane white bamboo sticks.
Some sensu have black-painted sticks and other sensu have plane white bamboo sticks.
Some sensu have black-painted sticks and other sensu have plane white bamboo sticks.

sen.j: 塗り生地の扇子は一般に中・上級者向けであるとされており、初心者は白生地を用いることが多い。
sen.e: Sensu with painted sticks should be used mainly by intermediate or advanced level people, and beginners generally use sensu with white sticks.
Sensu with painted sticks should be used mainly by intermediate or advanced level people, and beginners generally use sensu with white sticks.
Sensu with painted sticks should be used mainly by intermediate or advanced level people, and beginners generally use sensu with white sticks.

sen.j: また、寸法は男性用が大ぶりで女性用が小ぶりではあるが、流派によってまちまちである。
sen.e: Men's sensu are relatively big and women's sensu are relatively small, but size also varies depending on schools.
Men's sensu are relatively bigger and women's sensu are relatively smaller, but size also varies depending on schools.
Men's sensu are relatively bigger and women's sensu are relatively smaller, but size also varies depending on schools.

sen.j: そのため、稽古用として購入する場合はどの流派用かをきちんと伝える必要がある。
sen.e: For this reason, it is necessary for those who want to buy a new sensu for tea ceremony lessons to clarify which tea ceremony school they are going to join in.
For this reason, it is necessary for those who want to buy a new sensu for tea ceremony lessons to clarify which tea ceremony school they are going to join in.
For this reason, it is necessary for those who want to buy a new sensu for tea ceremony lessons to clarify which tea ceremony school they are going to join in.

sen.j: ただし、他流の茶会などへ招かれたときに自流の扇子を使うことは失礼に当たらないとされている。
sen.e: It is said, however, that using a sensu of one's own school at a tea ceremony party of another school is not rude.
It is said, however, that using a sensu of one's own school at a tea ceremony of another school is not rude.
It is said, however, that using a sensu of one's own school at a tea ceremony of another school is not rude.

sen.j: 毎年新年には勅題やその年の干支をあしらった扇子が発売される。
sen.e: New sensu decorated with the chokudai (subject of the New Year's Imperial Poetry Contest) or the Oriental zodiac sign of that year are released at the beginning of every year.
sen.cmt: 原文には「歌会始」とありますがリンク先の用語と混ざっているようです。ウェブを確認し、「勅題」として訳出いたしました。
sen.e: New sensu decorated with the chokudai (subject of the New Year's Imperial Poetry Contest) or the Oriental zodiac sign of that year are released at the beginning of every year.
sen.cmt: 原文には「歌会始」とありましたが、リンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると用語が「勅題」となっており、本来はこちらの用語を使用していると思われますので、こちらを訳出し、原文修正しました。
sen.e: New sensu decorated with the chokudai (subject of the New Year's Imperial Poetry Contest) or the Oriental zodiac sign of that year are released at the beginning of every year.

sen.j: 茶席でさまざまな用途に用いる和紙である。
sen.e: Kaishi is traditional Japanese paper used for various purposes at tea ceremonies.
Kaishi is traditional Japanese paper used for various purposes at tea ceremony.
Kaishi is traditional Japanese paper used for various purposes at tea ceremony.

sen.j: 和装の場合、茶席内では袱紗・古袱紗とともに懐に入れておく。
sen.e: While in Japanese dress, people keep kaishi inside the front flap of kimono, along with a fukusa and a kobukusa, at a tea ceremony.
While in Japanese dress, people keep kaishi inside the front flap of kimono, along with a fukusa and a kobukusa, at a tea ceremony.

sen.j: 洋装などの場合はそのまま茶席に持ち込む。
sen.e: While in Western dress, people bring kaishi to a tea ceremony, without putting it into a pocket or a pouch.

sen.j: 男性用・女性用で大きさに差がある。

sen.j: 主菓子が出された際に使用する菓子切り。

sen.j: ステンレス鋼製がよく用いられる。

sen.j: 持ち合わせがない場合は、受付などに申し出れば爪楊枝黒文字を用意してもらえることがある。
sen.e: Those who do not have any yoji can ask for one at a reception desk, and reception clerks are probably able to provide some kuromoji (high-grade toothpicks) for them.

tit.e: Kojakin (small wet cloth to wipe a tea bowl)
Kojakin (small wet cloth to wipe a tea bowl)

sen.j: 裏千家の濃茶席において、飲んだ後の茶碗の飲み口を清めるために用いる小布。
sen.e: This is a small cloth used to clean off the lip of a tea bowl after drinking tea at a koichaseki (ceremony of thick tea, which is made with three tea scoops of powdered tea per person) of the Urasenke school.

sen.j: 紙製のもの（紙小茶巾）もある。

sen.j: 濃茶席がなければ不要。

sen.j: 懐石の際、食べ残しを入れて持ち帰るための袋。

sen.j: 携帯時は小さくたたんでおき、使用する際に広げて箱状にする。

sen.j: 袱紗挟みよりさらに一回り大きな袋物として数寄屋袋（すきやぶくろ）がある。
